variant.name: Lacros
variant.summary: Handler which calls cleanup on Lacros

variant.name: LacrosOpenWindows
variant.summary: Handler for open browser windows on Lacros

histogram.name: Enterprise.AccountStatusCheckResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when user enters their account on license packged device during enrollment process.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ActiveDirectoryJoin
histogram.summary: The way device is joined to the Active Directory domain. This will be recorded during successful enterprise enrollment and domain join.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AttributesTPMConsistency
histogram.summary: Consistency between TPM lock state and absence/presence of install attributes at boot.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentBucketDownloadTime{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Duration of the bucket download part of the auto-enrollment protocol. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-12-26 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentControllerTimeout
histogram.summary: Count the number of timeouts and successes for AutoEnrollmentController.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentHashDanceSuccessTime{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPrivateSetMembershipSuccessTime
histogram.summary:
Duration of the private set membership request to determine enrollment state of the device. Only recorded if it finished successfully.
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2022-04-10 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentProtocolTime{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Total duration time of the auto-enrollment protocol. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2022-01-09 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPsmDmServerRequestStatus{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Device management server request status for auto-enrollment PSM requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-10-31 until 2021-11-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPsmRequestNetworkErrorCode{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment PSM requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-10-31 until 2021-11-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPsmResult{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
All possible PSM protocol results after it has executed succcessfully or terminated due to an error or timeout. This request is used to determine the initial enrollment state of the device. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-10-31 until 2021-11-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestNetworkErrorCode{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-12-19 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestStatus{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
URL fetcher status for auto-enrollment requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-12-12 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.BrowserSigninIOS.SignedOutByPolicy
histogram.summary: Recorded when a signed-in user is automatically signed out of the browser due to the BrowserSignin policy being set to 0 (sign-in disabled) by their organization. The sample is always recorded as true.

histogram.name: Enterprise.BrowserSigninIOS.SignInInterruptedByPolicy
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user is in the process of signing in to the browser, but is interrupted due to the BrowserSignin policy being set to 0 (sign-in disabled) by their organization. The sample is always recorded as true.

histogram.name: Enterprise.BrowserSigninPolicy
histogram.summary: Histogram for counting the BrowserSignin policy. This metric is recorded every 24 hours and at startup along with the full set of the enterprise policy rules that are in use.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CachedDevicePolicyDeviceIdValidity
histogram.summary: Result of the device ID validation in the device policy blob for those which were loaded from disk. This validation happens on enrolled devices on startup, on scheduled policy reloads that happen every few hours, and on forced policy reloads.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMPolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting CBCM policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMPolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing CBCM policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRealTimeReportEnqueue
histogram.summary: Recorded when real time report enter the queue. It indicates whether the report is pushed to the queue successfully or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRemoteCommand.Executed
histogram.summary: Events for counting status of executed CBCM remote commands. The metric includes only signed CBCM remote commands. Reports a final status of finished remote command (e.g. success, failure or termination).

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRemoteCommand.Received
histogram.summary: Events for counting received CBCM remote commands. The metric includes signed CBCM remote commands, both valid and invalid. Valid remote command is counted by its type. Invalid remote command is counted by a reason why it is considered invalid (e.g. unknown type or duplication).

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRemoteCommandInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting CBCM remote commands invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that there is a remote command to execute. Payloads provide context about the remote commands update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudExtensionRequestDialogAction
histogram.summary: Recorded once each time the extension request prompt dialog is accepted or aborted.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudExtensionRequestUpdated
histogram.summary: Recorded when cloud extension request pending list is updated. Note that when multiple requests are added or removed together, there will be only one event recorded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudManagementEnrollmentTokenLocation.Mac
histogram.summary: Records the enrollment token location when the token is loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingBasicRequestSize
histogram.summary: The proto size of the basic Chrome browser cloud management reporting request. When a report is separated into multiple requests, all of them contain the basic request.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingRequestCount
histogram.summary: The number of request for one Chrome browser cloud management report. A report is separated into multiple requests when it's too large.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingRequestSize
histogram.summary: The proto size of each Chrome browser cloud management reporting request. It includes the requests which are more than 5MB and discarded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingResponse
histogram.summary: The upload result for each cloud reporting request. Note that there may be multiple requests per report. Also, one request may creates multiple data point due to retry.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingUploadTrigger
histogram.summary: The trigger detected by the ReportScheduler responsible that led to an attempt to upload an enterprise report.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device local account policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2 counts only events of device policy invalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3
histogram.summary:
Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device local account policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DevicePolicyRefresh3 counts only events of refreshing device policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2 counts only events of device local account policy invalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyRefresh3
histogram.summary:
Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3 counts only events of refreshing device local account policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.Capturer.Aura.Created
histogram.summary: Reports the creation of AuraDesktopCapturer class object

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.Capturer.Aura.Destroyed
histogram.summary: Reports the destruction of AuraDesktopCapturer class object

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.Capturer.FrameSink.Created
histogram.summary: Reports the creation of FrameSinkDesktopCapturer class object

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.Capturer.FrameSink.Destroyed
histogram.summary: Reports the destruction of FrameSinkDesktopCapturer class object

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.Result
histogram.summary: Reports success/failure when a session is attempted.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.SessionType
histogram.summary: Reports the user type for the attempted session only when the result is EnterpriseCrdSessionResultCode::SUCCESS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Executed{Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}
histogram.summary: Events for counting status of executed device remote commands. The metric includes only signed device remote commands. Reports a final status of finished remote command (e.g. success, failure or termination). {Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Received
histogram.summary: Events for counting received device remote commands. The metric includes signed device remote commands, both valid and invalid. Valid remote command is counted by its type. Invalid remote command is counted by a reason why it is considered invalid (e.g. unknown type or duplication).

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommandInvalidations
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device remote commands invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that there is a remote command to execute. Payloads provide context about the remote commands update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
Metric is similar to Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2. Device local account scope does not exist for remote commands so there is no metric for remote commands similar to Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSettings.MissingPolicyMitigated
histogram.summary: Recorded every time policy file is missing or corrupted on Chrome OS. Should be compared to Enterprise.DeviceSettings.UpdatedStatus as happens only if status is STORE_NO_POLICY and device being not managed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSettings.UpdatedStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded every time as DeviceSettingsProvider updates its current state. Used to compare rate of Enterprise.DeviceSettings.MissingPolicyMitigated event.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.Failure.{Signal}.{ErrorType}Error
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever a {Signal} signal collection request failed with a {ErrorType} error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.Request.{Signal}.Items
histogram.summary: Captures the number of items as part of the {Signal} signal collection response. Recorded when the collection request was received. This histogram applies only to parameterized signals.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.Success.{Signal}.Items
histogram.summary: Captures the number of items collected in a {Signal} signal collection response. Recorded only when the collection request was successful and the signal value represents a collection.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.{Outcome}.{Signal}.Latency
histogram.summary: Captures the signal collection latency for the {Signal} signal. Recorded only when the collection {Outcome}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.{Signal}.Delta
histogram.summary: Captures the number of delta between requested and returned items as part of the {Signal} signal collection response. Recorded when the collection request was completed. This histogram applies only to parameterized signals.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a device signal collection request {Variant} for a particular signal.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.UserPermission
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission evaluation has been assessed for a particular user for whom device signals were requested.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Attestation.Funnel
histogram.summary: Various steps recorded when a device goes through the device trust connector attestation flow with a partner website.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Attestation.ResponseLatency.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Latency of a {Variant} attestation step in the overarching Device Trust connector's attestation flow. This measures the amount of time required to generate and return a response to the given challenge, which is effectively the last step in the overall attestation flow.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Attestation.Result
histogram.summary: Result of the attestation step in the overarching Device Trust connector's attestation flow. Logged whenever the attestation step finishes, success or failure, and right before the throttled request resumes.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.EnrollmentStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device starts the device trust attestation flow with a partner website. This captures the enrollment status of the device where the attestation flow is happening.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.TrustLevel
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Device Trust signing key is successfully loaded from persistence. This captures what trust level this key has, which in turn gives insights into how it was created (e.g. via a TPM or not).

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.Type
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Device Trust signing key is successfully loaded from persistence. This captures what algorithm this key was generated with.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.{Variant}Result
histogram.summary: Recorded every time the browser attempted to {Variant} a Device Trust signing key. This captures the result from this process.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Mac.SecureEnclaveOperation.{KeyType}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device attempts to issue an API that interacts with the Secure Enclave signing key in the {KeyType} key storage.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Origin
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device starts the device trust attestation flow with a partner website. This captures if the attestation flow was triggered inside of a session or on the login screen.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.RotateSigningKey.Tries
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device attempts to rotate its device trust signing key. Chrome will retry a fixed number of times until the operation either succeeds or fails. A value of 1 means the rotation worked on the first try.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.RotateSigningKey.{Nonce}.Status
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device attempts to rotate its device trust signing key. {Nonce}

variant.name: NoNonce
variant.summary: This occurs right after the device is enrolled with CBCM.

variant.name: WithNonce
variant.summary: This occurs when a device receives a command from the admin console.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.RotateSigningKey.{Nonce}.UploadCode
histogram.summary: HTTP status code of the key upload request recorded when a device attempts to rotate its device trust signing key. {Nonce}

variant.name: NoNonce
variant.summary: This occurs right after the device is enrolled with CBCM.

variant.name: WithNonce
variant.summary: This occurs when a device receives a command from the admin console.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.SignalsDecorator.Latency.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Latency recorded when the {Variant} decorator(s) finish collecting their signals. Captures the amount of time required to collect the signals under this scope.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ActiveFileEventsCount
histogram.summary: Number of non-expired file events stored in the DlpFilesController::EventStorage. It is recorded each time an entry is added or updated.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.CaptureModeInitBlocked
histogram.summary: Recorded when capture mode initialization was blocked by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.CaptureModeInitWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user is warned by Data Leak Prevention before capture mode initialization.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ClipboardReadBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a data read from the clipboard.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ConfidentialContentsCount
histogram.summary: Number of items stored in the DlpConfidentialContentsCache. It is recorded each time a new entry is cached.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DataTransferControllerStarted
histogram.summary: Recorded when DataTransferController is initialized, meaning that all clipboard and drag-n-drop operations will be affected by Data Leak Prevention checks.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DataTransferReportingTimeDiff
histogram.summary: Time difference between current and the latest sent Data Leak Prevention reporting events for data transfers for which sources and destinations are the same.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DlpPolicyPresent
histogram.summary: Recorded when non-empty Data Leak Prevention policy is present and due to that Data Leak Prevention infrastructure is initialized on the client.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DragDropBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a drag-n-drop operation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionBlocked
histogram.summary: Records which file action is blocked because of Data Leak Prevention policy restrictions.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionWarned
histogram.summary: Records which file action is warned because of Data Leak Prevention policy restrictions.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Records which file action was warned because of Data Leak Prevention policy restrictions and proceeded by the user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesDaemonStarted
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention policy contains Files restrictions and DLP Files daemon is started because of that.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for printing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for printing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user proceeded with (True) or canceled (False) the action after a Data Leak Prevention warning for printing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingWarnSilentProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share, but it is caused by the content that the user was already warned about and decided to proceed, so no new warning is shown and printing is silently allowed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrivacyScreenEnforced
histogram.summary: Recorded when privacy screen was enforced by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedBlockLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "block" level was reported. Identifies which restriction was blocked and reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedEventStatus
histogram.summary: Result of enqueueing Data Leak Prevention event to the reporting queue.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedReportLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "report" level was reported. Identifies which restriction was reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedWarnLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "warn" level was reported. Identifies which restriction was reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedWarnProceedLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "warn" level was reported after a user proceeded with a restricted action. Identifies which restriction was reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.RestrictionConfigured
histogram.summary: Records which types of restrictions are present in Data Leak Prevention policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenSharePausedOrResumed
histogram.summary: Recorded when screen share was paused (True) or resumed (False) by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user proceeded with (True) or canceled (False) the action after a Data Leak Prevention warning for a screen share.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareWarnSilentProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share, but it is caused by the content that the user was already warned about and decided to proceed, so no new warning is shown and the screen share is silently allowed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for taking a screenshot or a video capture.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for taking a screenshot or a video capture.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user proceeded with (True) or canceled (False) the action after a Data Leak Prevention warning shown at the capture mode initialization or before taking a screenshot or a video capture.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotWarnSilentProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for initiating capture mode, or taking a screenshot or a video capture, but it is caused by the content that the user was already warned about and decided to proceed, so no new warning is shown and the screen share is silently allowed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.VideoCaptureInterrupted
histogram.summary: Recorded when video capture was interrupted by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMServerRequestSuccess{EnterpriseDMServerRequest}
histogram.summary: Number of retries the client did to execute a DeviceManagementServer request. It's recorded after the request has been completed, either successfully after 0 or more retries, with a failure (too many retries or non-retriable error) or with a server error. {EnterpriseDMServerRequest}

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrolledDevicePolicyPresent
histogram.summary: Whether loading of device policy from file on an enterprise-enrolled (checked against install_attributes.pb) Chrome OS device yields an enterprise policy. Filled once during session startup, after first successful device policy read.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrolledPolicyHasDMToken
histogram.summary: Whether loading of device policy from file on an enterprise-enrolled (checked against install_attributes.pb) Chrome OS device yields an enterprise policy with a DM token. Filled once during session startup, after first successful device policy read.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Events related to device enrollment on new installs of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentAttestationBased
histogram.summary:
Events related to attestation-based enrollment (Zero-Touch) of Chrome OS devices.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-12-05 to 2022-02-01. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentAttestationBased.EnrollmentCertificateStatus.InitialAttempt
histogram.summary:
Status of possibly existing cached enrollment certificate recorded at the first registration attempt during attestation-based enrollment.
Note that the certificate request status is not in the scope of this metric and is recorded on "EnterpriseEnrollmentType" events by "Enterprise.Enrollment*" metrics.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentAttestationBased.EnrollmentCertificateStatus.SubsequentAttempt
histogram.summary:
Status of refreshed enrollment certificate recorded at the subsequent registration attempt during attestation-based enrollment.
Note that the certificate request status is not in the scope of this metric and is recorded on "EnterpriseEnrollmentType" events by "Enterprise.Enrollment*" metrics.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForced
histogram.summary: Events related to forced re-enrollment (FRE) of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedAttestationBased
histogram.summary: Events related to attestation-based re-enrollment (Auto RE) of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedInitial
histogram.summary: Events related to forced initial enrollment of Chrome OS devices during the first startup of a device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedInitialAttestationBased
histogram.summary: Events related to attestation-based initial enrollment (Zero-Touch) of Chrome OS devices during the first startup of a device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedInitialManualFallback
histogram.summary: Events related to manual fallback from attestation-based initial enrollment (Zero-Touch) of Chrome OS devices during the first startup of a device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedManualFallback
histogram.summary:
Events related to manual fallback from attestation-based re-enrollment (Auto RE) of Chrome OS devices.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-12-05 to 2022-02-01. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRecovery
histogram.summary: Events related to Chrome OS enterprise enrollment recovery. Note that this only covers cases in which prior to recovery, the "private owner" of the device had UMA stats enabled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRollbackAttestation
histogram.summary:
Events related to attestation based re-enrollment after enterprise rollback.
Events are recorded during enrollment after rollback and types are listed in the MetricEnrollment enum.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRollbackManualFallback
histogram.summary:
Events related to manual re-enrollment after enterprise rollback. This is used when attestation based enrollment fails.
Events are recorded during enrollment after rollback and types are listed in the MetricEnrollment enum.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Cancel
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment was cancelled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Failure
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Success
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment succeeded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnterCriticalPolicySectionDelay.Total
histogram.obsolete: Remove after M105. Data is static hence there is no need to keep monitoring.
histogram.summary: Elapsed time taken to acquire each lock to access policies in the Windows registry (at user scope and then at machine scope). This metric is recorded shortly after browser startup once with the combined wait time for both locks regardless of success or failure.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnterCriticalPolicySectionDelay.{Scope}.{Result}
histogram.obsolete: Remove after 2022-06. Data is static hence there is no need to keep monitoring.
histogram.summary: Elapsed time taken to acquire the lock to access policies in the Windows registry. The success or failure variant of this metric is recorded once for user scope and then once for machine scope shortly after browser startup.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnterCriticalPolicySectionError
histogram.obsolete: Remove after M105. Data is static hence there is no need to keep monitoring.
histogram.summary: Windows error code following a failure to acquire the lock to access policies in the Windows registry shortly after browser startup.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.CBCMPolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting CBCM policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service. Subset of "Enterprise.CBCMPolicyInvalidations". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.CBCMPolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing CBCM policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh. Subset of "Enterprise.CBCMPolicyRefresh". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device local account policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service. Subset of "Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DevicePolicyInvalidations2 counts only events of device policy invalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3
histogram.summary:
Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device local account policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh. Subset of "Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DevicePolicyRefresh3 counts only events of refreshing device policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DevicePolicyInvalidations2
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service. Subset of "Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2 counts only events of device local account policy invalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DevicePolicyRefresh3
histogram.summary:
Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh. Subset of "Enterprise.DevicePolicyRefresh3". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3 counts only events of refreshing device local account policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.PolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting user policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service. Subset of "Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.PolicyInvalidationsRegistrationResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of registration for policy invalidations. It will fail when duplicate invalidation names are used for different policies due to http://b/119860379. Subset of "Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsRegistrationResult". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FCMInvalidationService.PolicyRefresh2
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing user policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh. Subset of "Enterprise.PolicyRefresh2". Gets recorded only when FCMInvalidationService is used as InvalidationService.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FileSystem.DownloadsRouting
histogram.summary: The intended routing destination of each downloaded item when the Enterprise Filesystem connector is enabled. Each file is either not routed to any cloud provider, or routed to Box. Gets recorded every time a file is downloaded with the filesystem connector enabled, whether or not the file is eventually uploaded to the cloud.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FileSystem.DownloadsRouting.Box
histogram.summary: The final result of a file routed to Box by the filesystem connector. The file routing may a) succeed b) be canceled by the user c) fail due to a Box error d) fail due to a browser error, e) fail due to a file error OR f) fail due to a network error. Gets recorded every time a file is downloaded with the filesystem connector enabled, whether or not the file is eventually uploaded to the cloud.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FileSystem.Uniquifier
histogram.summary: The number of alternate filenames tried to avoid a filename collision when uploading to the cloud storage provider. If there is a collision filenames of the form "filename (%d).ext" are used for "filename.ext", and after 10 retries we fallback to a timestamp based name "filename - YYYY-MM-ddTHHMMss.SSS UTC+HHmm.ext", and abandon if that fails.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FirstRun.AppRestrictionLoadTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to retrieve applicaton restrictions from the system using an AsyncTask. Recording during first run experience on Android only.

histogram.name: Enterprise.FirstRun.AppRestrictionLoadTime.Medium
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to retrieve applicaton restrictions from the system using an AsyncTask. Recording during first run experience on Android only. Has a bigger range (0-3 minutes) than the non-Medium version.

histogram.name: Enterprise.InvalidDevicePolicyFilesStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. Result of checking if device policy files are valid when reading the device policy data.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IOSPolicies
histogram.summary: Number of policies loaded at startup on iOS, and when a change is detected at runtime.

histogram.name: Enterprise.LoginApiCleanup.{CleanupHandler}.Success
histogram.summary: ChromeOS only. Records if cleanup handler succeeded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.LoginApiCleanup.{CleanupHandler}.Timing
histogram.summary: ChromeOS only. Records the duration the cleanup handler took.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.DMTokenDeletion
histogram.summary: Records whether browser unenrollment via DMToken deletion completed succcessfully after attempting to delete the token.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.RequestFailureTime
histogram.summary: Time since the enrollment request was made until an error is returned from the server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.RequestSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Time since the enrollment request was made until a successful enrollment response is returned from the server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.Result
histogram.summary: The result of machine level user cloud policy enrollment.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.StartupDialog
histogram.summary: Records whether the machine level user cloud policy enrollment dialog is shown to the user and the action they took.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.StartupDialogTime
histogram.summary: The length of time the machine level user cloud policy enrollment dialog was visible to the user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.UnenrollSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether a browser unenrollment was completed succcessfully by writing an invalid DM token to storage or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ManagementAuthorityThrustworthiness.Cache.ValueChange
histogram.summary: Recorded after the ManagementStatus cache is updated. Reports whether the Management authority thrustworthiness changed after the cache update.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MultipartDataPipe.WriteDuration
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded every time a file is uploaded for deep scanning. It measures the total duration for a complete writing of the file from the browser process to the network service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MultipartDataPipe.WriteRate
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded every time a file is uploaded for deep scanning. It measures the writing rate of that file's contents from the browser process to the network service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OnBulkDataEntry.DataSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (in bytes) of data that might have been scanned by the OnBulkDataEntry Enterprise Connector. Is is logged once per user action that would trigger this Connector.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ONC.PolicyValidation
histogram.summary: Result of the OpenNetworkConfiguration policy validation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies.IgnoredByPolicyGroup
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are ignored because they do not share the highest priority from their policy atomic group. This is recorded at startup, then every 24 hours. If chrome is not running at the 24 hours mark, this will be recorded at the next startup.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies.Sources
histogram.summary:
Record summary of sources of all policies. It's recorded ever 24 hours and at startup.
This does not include user cloud policy and some speicial policy sources like enterprise_default.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies.{PolicyLevel}
histogram.summary: A set of {PolicyLevel} enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded for each {PolicyLevel} policy every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting user policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsRegistrationResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of registration for policy invalidations. It will fail when duplicate invalidation names are used for different policies due to http://b/119860379.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsStartupTime
histogram.summary: Time since startup of the cloud policy code until the policy invalidation service first reported its online status.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Load status from the policy loaders which pull policy settings from the underlying platform, such as Windows Group Policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyRefresh2
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing user policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUpdatePeriod.Device
histogram.summary: Time since last device policy fetch. Emitted when policies are loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUpdatePeriod.MachineLevelUser
histogram.summary: Time since last machine level user policy fetch.. Emitted when policies are loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUpdatePeriod.User
histogram.summary: Time since last user policy fetch. Emitted when policies are loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUserVerification
histogram.summary: Tracking the results of policy user verification.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileSeparation.DasherPolicyFetch.HttpResponse
histogram.summary: The Http statuses returned by the server when trying to get the ManagedAccounsSigninRestriction policy value for individual dasher accounts. This is recorded after trying to the the policy value, when the status is available.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileSeparation.DasherPolicyFetch.NetworkError
histogram.summary: The network errors that happen when trying to get the ManagedAccounsSigninRestriction policy value for individual dasher accounts. This is recorded every time after trying to the the policy value.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PublicSession.ExtensionPermissions
histogram.summary: Extensions (and apps) are quite restricted in public sessions for security and privacy concerns - some permissions are blocked which means the extension itself is blocked (prevented from loading). This histogram counts requested permissions on extension installation in public sessions (both installed and blocked extensions).

histogram.name: Enterprise.PublicSession.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A public session starts when a user signs in using the policy configured public account. It stops when the user signs out. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length rounded down to the nearest 10-minute bucket and capped at 24 hours.

histogram.name: Enterprise.RealtimeReportingSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of retries the client did to execute a real-time reporting upload request. It's recorded after the request has been completed, either successfully after 0 or more retries, with a failure (too many retries or non-retriable error) or with a server error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.RegularUserSession.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A regular user session starts when a user signs in using his/her user account. It stops when the user signs out. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length on an enrolled device rouned down to the nearest 10-minute bucket and capped at 24 hours.

histogram.name: Enterprise.RemoteCommandInvalidationsRegistrationResult
histogram.summary:
Tracks whether remote commands invalidator registered for corresponding invalidations. In case of success the invalidator is able to receive incoming invalidations.
Metric is similar to Enterprise.PolicyInvalidationsRegistrationResult.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage.PolicyFetch.ResponseLatency
histogram.summary: Latency of a SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage policy fetch request. This measures the amount of time required to fetch the policy value of SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage from the Secure Connect API. This is recorded when a user account is added as a secondary account (in-session).

histogram.name: Enterprise.SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage.PolicyFetch.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of UserCloudSigninRestrictionPolicyFetcherChromeOS::GetSecondaryGoogleAccountUsage. This is recorded when a user account is added as a secondary account (in-session).

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemFeaturesDisableList
histogram.summary: Shows which system features are set to be disabled by SystemFeaturesDisableList policy. Recorded when the policy preference is updated with a new system feature. No-op updates aren't counted.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemLogUploadResult
histogram.summary: Result of a single attempt to upload system logs.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WMI.{Signal}.ParsingError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever parsing of {Signal} from WMI results failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WMI.{Signal}.QueryError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever collection of {Signal} from WMI failed with a query error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WSC.AntiVirus.ParsingError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever parsing of AntiVirus info from WSC results failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WSC.AntiVirus.QueryError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever collection of AntiVirus info from WSC failed with a query error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.{Signal}.ParsingError.Rate
histogram.summary: Captures the response parsing error rate whenever collecting {Signal}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.ChildUser.OAuthTokenError
histogram.summary: Failure reason for OAuth token fetch for child user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.DelayInitialization
histogram.summary: Initialization delay due to loading the user policy cache.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.ClientError
histogram.summary: Policy client error during initial policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayClientRegister
histogram.summary: Delay for registering the client with the policy server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayOAuth2Token
histogram.summary: Delay for minting an OAuth2 acccess token.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayPolicyFetch
histogram.summary: Delay for fetching policy from the policy server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.DelayTotal
histogram.summary: Total delay for the initial policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2Error
histogram.summary: Service error during OAuth2 access token fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2NetworkError
histogram.summary: Network error during OAuth2 access token fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.ReregistrationResult
histogram.summary: Re-registration results after failed policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserRemoteCommand.Executed{Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}
histogram.summary: Events for counting status of executed user remote commands. The metric includes only signed user remote commands. Reports a final status of finished remote command (e.g. success, failure or termination). {Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserRemoteCommand.Received
histogram.summary: Events for counting received user remote commands. The metric includes signed user remote commands, both valid and invalid. Valid remote command is counted by its type. Invalid remote command is counted by a reason why it is considered invalid (e.g. unknown type or duplication).

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserRemoteCommandInvalidations
histogram.summary:
Events for counting user remote commands invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that there is a remote command to execute. Payloads provide context about the remote commands update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
Metric is similar to Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserSession.Logins
histogram.summary: Tracks the sign-in events on an enrolled device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VerifiedAccess.SAML.DeviceTrustMatchesEndpoints
histogram.summary: Recorded when building a response for a challenge from Verified Access server for remote attestation during SAML authentication. This captures if Device Trust is configured alongside Verified Access for the current endpoint or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VPDCacheReadResult
histogram.summary: The result of Chrome reading the VPD cache on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VpdCheck
histogram.summary: The status code (exit code or signal) from sanity check of RW_VPD read and matching the contents with data from dump_vpd_log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Enterprise.VpdUpdateStatus
histogram.summary: The status code (exit code or signal) from VPD update operation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.AzureADJoinStatusCheckTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed for checking the Azure AD join status. This is only recorded once during the first successful join status check.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InDomain
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is part of an AD domain. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidJsonPolicies
histogram.summary:
A set of policy rules that failed validation due to unparsable JSON, or JSON that did not match the schema. This validation happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2020-06-18 until 2021-03-15.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPolicies
histogram.summary: A set of policy rules that were ignored due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPoliciesDetected
histogram.summary: The number of disabled policy entries on Windows due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsDomainJoined
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is joined to an AD domain. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsEnterpriseUser
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is considered an enterprise user. An enterprise user is either in a domain, either local or cloud via AAD. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsFullyManaged2
histogram.summary: On Android (OS version Lollipop+): Whether the device has a "device owner" app installed. This check is performed once on application start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsJoinedToAzureAD
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is joined to an Azure AD domain or the user has added one or more work/school accounts to their login session. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsLocalMachine
histogram.summary: Whether the full machine name is the same as the short one, identifying a local machine. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsLocalUser
histogram.summary: Whether the currently logged in user is a local user or not, based on its SAM compatible user name and machine name. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsManaged2
histogram.summary: On Windows: Whether the machine is managed via MDM. On macOS: Whether Chrome found a file of managed policies to follow. On Android (OS version Lollipop+): Whether the device has a profile owner app. This check is performed once on application start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsManagedOrEnterpriseDevice
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is managed or part of an enterprise. This includes devices that are either in a domain or managed via MDM. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsCurrentUserDomainUser
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the current user has an enterprise identity in Open Directory. This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsDeviceDomainJoined
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the machine is joined to a domain. This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsDeviceMDMEnrolledNew
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the machine is managed via MDM, with data obtained via a new method (profiles) that is only available in 10.13.4 or later. This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsDeviceMDMEnrolledOld
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the machine is managed via MDM, with data obtained via an old method (system_profiler). This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.NetGetJoinInformationAddress
histogram.summary: Whether we could obtain the address of the NetGetJoinInformation function. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.
